Sentencas: An elementary kinetic model is established to represent the coupled behavior of (electro)-chemistry, transport and degradation processes in the porous Ni/YSZ anode of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study

Sentencas: This model is applied to support the development and evaluation of solid carbon formation mechanisms at Ni/YSZ anodes.
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study

Sentencas: The simulation of cells, operated on partially reformed hydrocarbons, show that performance and degradation are influenced significantly by the operation temperature and applied potential.
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study

Sentencas: Specifically at OCV and high temperature (>1000 K), a surface carbon layer is formed which covers Ni surface and Ni/YSZ/gas-phase three-phase boundary, blocking heterogeneous and charge-transfer reactions.
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study

Sentencas: However, at lower temperature (<1000 K) carbon growth mainly proceeds inside the anode porous phase leading to significant diffusion polarization.
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study

Sentencas: At constant current densities, the amount of formed carbon is substantially lower, however, it causes undesirable effect, such as dusting of Ni particles.
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study

Sentencas: Experimental data from literature is used for model validation.
Titulo: Reformate-operated SOFC anode performance and degradation considering solid carbon formation: A modeling and simulation study
